rules: Rule1: If the brewery acquires a game license, then it is operational.
Rule2: Either the brewery acquires a game license or it acquires a legislation permit.
Rule3: Whenever the brewery launches a new beer product, a successful launch follows.
Rule4: Under the condition that the brewery launches a new beer product, it has a popular new beer product.

Rule5: Either the brewery launches a new beer product or it avoids a recall of a financial product, or if it is not the case that delaying maintenance implies maintaining the tool, then it causes a recall of a financial product.
Rule6: If the brewery increases marketing for a financial product, then breaking even implies it is profitable for the quarter.
Rule7: Under the condition that the brewery reduces costs for a financial product, breaking even leads to it being profitable for the quarter.
Rule8: If the brewery misses the profit goal target, then it meets the profit goal target.
Rule9: If the brewery performs quality control on alcohol, then it tests a sample of alcohol.
Rule10: Either the brewery fails the alcohol test or, if it is not the case that testing a sample implies non-operationality leading to contaminated product, then it does not pass the alcohol test.
Rule11: Whenever the brewery discards a batch of alcohol, it does not fail the alcohol test.
Rule12: The brewery sells a batch of alcohol or it discards a batch of alcohol.
Rule13: The brewery implements a fix for a tool or it reviews a procedure for a tool.
Rule14: Under the condition that the brewery reviews a procedure for a tool, investigating a complaint leads to not receiving a complaint.
Rule15: If the brewery modifies the recipe for a new beer, then launching a new beer product implies it does not have a popular new beer product.
Rule16: Whenever the brewery receives customer feedback on a new beer, it keeps the recipe for a new beer.
Rule17: The brewery receives customer feedback on a new beer or it conducts internal testing on a new beer.
Rule18: Provided that the brewery conducts internal testing on a new beer, it modifies the recipe for a new beer.
Rule19: If the brewery performs emergency maintenance on a tool, then it orders a replacement for the tool.
Rule20: Whenever the brewery performs emergency maintenance on a tool, it does not complete repairs on the tool.
Rule21: Provided that the brewery orders a replacement for a tool, it completes repairs on the tool.
Rule22: Either the brewery undergoes a compliance audit for legislation or delaying maintenance implies maintaining brewing equipment.
Rule23: Under the condition that the brewery appeals the decision on legislation, it does not fail the audit for legislation.
Rule24: The brewery appeals the decision on legislation or it accepts a fine for legislation.
Rule25: Whenever the brewery accepts a fine for legislation, it does not fail the audit for legislation.

Rule26: Provided that the brewery issues a refund for a financial product, if it is not the case that delaying maintenance implies maintaining the tool, then it causes a recall of a financial product.
Rule27: Either the brewery denies a claim for a financial product or it issues a refund for a financial product.
Rule28: The brewery processes insurance for a financial product or it rejects a claim for a financial product.
Rule29: Provided that the brewery fails the quality check inspection, it passes the quality check inspection.
Rule30: Whenever the brewery rejects a claim for a financial product, it does not deny a claim for a financial product.
Rule31: If the brewery approves a claim for a financial product, then it does not deny a claim for a financial product.
Rule32: Under the condition that the brewery has coverage for a financial product, processing insurance implies approving a claim.
Rule33: Provided that the brewery sanitizes brewing equipment, it does not use contaminated equipment.
Rule34: If the brewery maintains brewing equipment, then it does not use contaminated equipment.
Rule35: Whenever the brewery schedules maintenance for brewing equipment, it sanitizes brewing equipment.
Rule36: The brewery schedules maintenance for brewing equipment or it delays maintenance for brewing equipment.
Rule37: Provided that it is not the case that delaying maintenance implies maintaining brewing equipment, it does not cause a recall of a financial product.
Rule38: If it is not the case that the brewery increases marketing or reduces costs for a financial product, then it misses the profit goal target.
Rule39: Whenever it is not the case that the brewery increases marketing or reduces costs for a financial product, it does not meet the profit goal target.
Rule40: Provided that it is not the case that acquiring a legislation permit implies the brewery is operational, it violates alcohol sales regulations.
Rule41: If it is not the case that testing a sample implies non-operationality leading to contaminated alcohol, then the brewery passes the alcohol test.
Rule42: Under the condition that it is not the case that implementing a fix implies investigating a complaint leads to not receiving a complaint, the brewery updates a protocol for legislation.
Rule43: If it is not the case that implementing a fix implies investigating a complaint leads to not receiving a complaint, then it does not update a protocol for legislation.
Rule44: Provided that it is not the case that undergoing a compliance audit implies passing the audit, the brewery fails the audit for legislation.
Rule45: Under the condition that it is not the case that the brewery sanitizes or maintains brewing equipment, it experiences equipment failure with a tool.

Rule46: Provided that it is not the case that the negation of acquiring a legislation permit implying operationality leads to not violating alcohol sales regulations, it fails the quality check inspection.

Rule47: Under the condition that it is not the case that the negation of sanitizing or maintaining brewing equipment leading to no equipment failure holds, the brewery performs emergency maintenance on a tool.
Rule48: If the brewery does not have coverage for a financial product, then it lacks coverage for a financial product.
Rule49: Under the condition that the brewery is not operational, it breaks even.
Rule50: Whenever the brewery is not operational, it receives a complaint from a customer.
Rule51: Provided that the brewery is not operational, it investigates a complaint from a customer.
Rule52: Under the condition that the brewery is not operational, it uses contaminated equipment.
Rule53: If the brewery is not operational, then it is not profitable for the quarter.
facts: Fact1: The brewery performs quality control on alcohol.
Fact2: It is not the case that the brewery avoids a recall of a financial product.
Fact3: It is not the case that the brewery achieves a successful launch of a new beer.
Fact4: The brewery does not produce contaminated alcohol.
Fact5: The brewery does not sell a batch of alcohol.
Fact6: It is not the case that the brewery keeps the recipe for a new beer.
Fact7: The brewery does not pass the quality check inspection.
Fact8: The brewery does not pass the audit for legislation.
Fact9: It is not the case that the brewery lacks coverage for a financial product.
